<header className="hero">

# Themes


</header>

By default, every FastStore project comes with the [Brandless theme](/docs/theming-overview#brandless-and-theming-structure). However, you have the option to use one of the [available themes](#available-themes) or [create a custom theme](#creating-a-custom-theme).


<Callout type="info" emoji="ℹ️">
  You have the flexibility and freedom to style the theme by overriding it using global or local tokens, or by starting from scratch using your preferred styling tool.
</Callout>

---

## Creating a Custom Theme

1. Create a new `.scss` file on `src/themes` (e.g. `my-theme.scss`) in your [starter](https://github.com/vtex-sites/starter.store), then add the tokens you want to overwrite inside the `.theme` class.

<Callout type="info" emoji="ℹ️">
  If you want, you can work on `custom-theme.scss` file that's ready to use.
</Callout>

<br></br>

```scss filename="src/themes/my-theme.scss"
.theme {
  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Colors (Branding Core)
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Typography (Branding Core)
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Spacing (UI Essentials)
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Grid & Layout (UI Essentials)
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Interactive Controls (UI Essentials)
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // Refinements
  // --------------------------------------------------------

  // --------------------------------------------------------
  // FS UI Components
  // --------------------------------------------------------
    .section {
      // Add here the customizations for FastStore UI components.
    }
}
```
<br></br>

2. Go to `faststore.config.js` and changes the `theme` from `custom-theme` to your file's name:

```js filename="faststore.config.js"
theme: 'my-theme',
```
